title: PHPcal_info()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPcal_info()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Return information about the Gregorian calendar:
<?php
print_r(cal_info(0));
?>
Run Example »
Definition and Usage
The cal_info() function returns information about a specified calendar.
Syntax
cal_info(
calendar);
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
calendar
Optional. Specifies a number that indicates which calendar to return information about:
0 = CAL_GREGORIAN
1 = CAL_JULIAN
2 = CAL_JEWISH
3 = CAL_FRENCH
Tip:
If the
calendar
parameter is omitted,   cal_info() returns info about all calendars
Technical Details
Return Value:
Returns an array containing calendar elements like:
calname
calsymbol
month
abbrevmonth
maxdaysinmonth
PHP Version:
4.1+
Changelog:
In PHP 5.0 the
calendar
parameter became optional

★
+1
